definition: approaching one's end/with one foot in the grave
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: I'm going to give you some parting advice.
sentences.chinese: 我想给你个临终前的建议。

sentences.english: And I couldn’t get Daddy and his confident deathbed prediction that I would win out of my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我始终想着老爸在临终前确信的预言，他说我会胜出。

sentences.english: I called the local hospice after consulting with Dr. Isaacoff.
sentences.chinese: 向艾萨科夫咨询后，我打电话给当地临终医院。

sentences.english: At the end of the day you have the final say on how you experience reality.
sentences.chinese: 这样在你临终的时候你才能说你切切实实地经历过。

sentences.english: Before his death, your uncle hid a mysterious artifact that only you could find.
sentences.chinese: 在临终前，你的叔叔藏起了一个只有你能找到的神器。

sentences.english: In road politics appoint unfortunate sacrifice, mortal before entrust Qiu Yongnian finishes the job.
sentences.chinese: 途中政委不幸牺牲，临终前托付邱永年完成任务。

sentences.english: They wanted me to have a letter he had written to me a few days prior to his death.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望我读一下马修在临终前几天写给我的一封信。

sentences.english: And, of course, when he died, he didn't die a pauper.
sentences.chinese: 当然，他临终时并非是个穷光蛋。

sentences.english: Earlier, this was called Extreme Unction.
sentences.chinese: 早些时候，这是所谓的临终。

sentences.english: What did Kerchak ask Tarzan to do before he died?
sentences.chinese: 克察克临终前嘱咐泰山做什么？

sentences.english: The old man panted forth the hope on his deathbed will.
sentences.chinese: 老人临终时气喘吁吁地说出了他的临终遗嘱。

sentences.english: The old man panted forth the hope on his deathbed will.
sentences.chinese: 老人临终时气喘吁吁地说出了他的临终遗嘱。

sentences.english: Don found a hospice nurse, and within two days Mr.Brick died.
sentences.chinese: 唐找了位临终护理人员，布瑞克先生不到两天就走了。

sentences.english: Can there be any consolation at the last moment?
sentences.chinese: 任何的慰籍会在临终一刻出现吗？

sentences.english: She added a codicil to her will just before she died.
sentences.chinese: 临终前在遗嘱上加了附录。

definition: on one's deathbed/at the point of death
words of the deceased/last words of the dying/wisdom of past sages
to be critically ill/to be terminally ill
seriously ill and about to die
(of a deceased) during one's life/while living
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
